definitions: To compel or make someone or something enter a place or situation against their will or natural inclination.
To make something fit into a space or container that is too small or not designed for it.
To cause someone to accept or adopt a particular role, belief, or course of action, often unwillingly.
examples: They had to force the key into the rusty lock.
The company tried to force new policies into effect.
He was forced into early retirement.
Don't force your opinions into every conversation.
